intro: Evax filaginoides, commonly known as the slender filagrate, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a rough texture. Evax filaginoides is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
